content.body: Luke Warlow: curious, which subtests are you looking at in https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/12016 ?
content.formatted_body: Luke Warlow: curious, which subtests are you looking at in https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/12016 ?

content.body: "customElements.define must get callbacks of the constructor prototype" was I believe one of them, but basically all the customElements.define ones
And IIRC there is an old issue to make the spec bit more reasonable by relying on a webidl dictionary
(I'd be surprised if all the .define ones check the order)
I can't remember having any issues with this when implementing, so I wonder if I just accidentally somehow got the same result as in wpt
I'm guessing you either looked at WPT for the ordering *or* put it in the logical place, and it happened to match WPT.
content.formatted_body: I'm guessing you either looked at WPT for the ordering or put it in the logical place, and it happened to match WPT.

content.body: Luke Warlow: I think https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3580 is the other issue I'm thinking
content.formatted_body: Luke Warlow: I think https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3580 is the other issue I'm thinking

content.body: * Luke Warlow: https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3580 is the other issue I'm thinking
content.formatted_body: * Luke Warlow: https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3580 is the other issue I'm thinking

m.new_content.body: Luke Warlow: https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3580 is the other issue I'm thinking
m.new_content.formatted_body: Luke Warlow: https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3580 is the other issue I'm thinking

content.body: I think it's just a simple switcheroo in the spec as a quick fix. Firefox and Chromium agree, and I've swapped my Servo PR to use what's in the test.
yeah, the order shouldn't really matter in practice
